definition: relating to, being, or appealing to affluent consumers, of a superior quality
to make (something) more appealing to affluent consumers : to make (something) more upscale, to improve the quality of (something)
examples: The council is renaming them the Fashion Awards, globalizing them, moving the hoopla around them to the Royal Albert Hall and otherwise upscaling them.
"Everybody's trying to upscale men's colognes because the prestige brands have taken share from the mass brands," says cosmetics industry consultant Allan Mottus.
… even retained a handwriting teacher to upscale her penmanship—no more tiny circles over her i's.

definition: to increase the size; scope, or scale of (something)
examples: A star is an upscaled nuclear reactor, not a bonfire.
As a result, an upscaling of the problem of underrepresentation to the national scale mobilizes scalar politics …

definition: to or toward the upper, more expensive end of a range of products or services
examples: He tried to move upscale—toward higher-cost, higher-profit garments, which, in theory, would be less susceptible to price competition.
… chef Celestino Drago has taken Sicilian cuisine upscale in his chic Santa Monica restaurant.
